column1: Inflammation of the Eye Following Surgery
column2: terryd, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I had a mini shunt implant and was prescribed this med for inflammation.  Was told I would be on it 4x's a day for apx 90 days.  It's been 2 weeks and have experienced mood swings, headaches and nausea. I get crying spells, and am very depressed, which is so not like me.   I am also on 2 other drops, so not sure which one is causing the effects, or if it a combination.  I'm concerned about the long term effects of steroids on other organs. I didn't know about applying pressure on the corner of the eye to prevent it from getting in to the system, thank you for that information, I will start doing that to see if it helps.

column1: Inflammation of the Eye Following Surgery
column2: NeverAgain, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I had a trabulectomy with shunt & was on this every 3 hours for 3 weeks to prevent swelling. It made me so enraged I was bordering on being a lunatic so filled with anger that I felt like I could bite someones face off if they just looked at me the wrong way! I was screaming at the top of my lungs for minor annoyances! I felt like I wanted to crawl out of my own skin. It is like PMSing 1000 fold. It also made me so depressed all I wanted to do was sleep! I think it made my other eyes vison worse- It kept getting worse and worse over 3 weeks time to the point I cannot read with my unoperated on eye! I'm hoping that side effect goes away! I didn't need eye glasses for that eye before using THIS! If you have to use it remember to hold pressure with your finger on the inside corner of your eye for 2 to 3 minutes- this prevents the medicine from getting into your system-Not all Drs inform their patients on this- I was seeing Eye drs for 4 years before someone finally told me that was the proper way to put drops in! I would not reccomend this medicine unless you have no choice and have to use it after surgery. I'm normally a calm, peaceful person who abhors anger and violence- this made me extremely agitated, enraged, & depressed.

column1: Severe Inflammation of the Eye
column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Have had Uveitis for 20+ years, and this drug really works to control what is a chronic condition that can eventually cause blindness if not controlled.  Not sure what causes this inflammation, but it can be extremely painful.  Don't use the generic! Doesn't work and there are studies.  I was on a generic for several weeks and the condition only got worse, for the first time in my 20 years.

column1: Other
column2: sjhg, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I had two cataract and two DSAEK corneal tissue implants total. Started this drug (along with others) more than six months ago at the start of these four procedures, and never had an infection or any problem, so I guess it works. Still using it three times/day. However, I am getting big hemorrhages in the white parts of my eyes very regularly - not painful really except discomfort just before they let loose -and it looks really awful! They take a couple days to go away and meanwhile it feels like there's something in my eye - that annoying feeling something is there. Anyway, my ophthalmologist says it's not an eye problem, its a blood pressure problem, but my BP is controlled at a low level and it's always fine when I check it shortly after the hemorrhage occurs. The drug sheet says an adverse reaction is conjunctival hyperemia; could Prednisolone be causing this?

column1: Inflammation of the Uvea of the Eye
column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I have been using this medication for years for flare up's due to uveitis. The drops taste horrible, when you put a drop in an eye right after press on your eye duct ( corner of your eye ) with your finger for about a minute.  This helps the medication from draining to the back of throat- which taste awful and will give you an upset stomach. Have had to take once every hour for weeks with adding dilating drops for my cycle.  It does work- but seems I flare up more when i completely stop.  Have asked my doctor to keep me on a low dose to use at least 3x's a day to help keep it at rest.  Hope this helps.

I was also told to use otc artificial tears between the prescribed doses.

column2: Dee, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Not satisfied at all with this medication.  It leaves a whiteish film in eyes that goes to corner of the eye.  Is this suppose to be left in the eye or is this film to be taken out?  No directions at all on the Rx box nor on the pamphlet inside the Rx box.  Afterwards I would have itching and burning and pain down into my sinuses all around my entire eye clear up to my forehead.  Is this a sign that the medicine is working?  Or is this a sign I cannot use this medication?  I wasn't thrilled about putting a steroid into my eyes in the first place!!!  I wonder if this is causing more harm than good.  My eye doctor said I have meibomianitis.  When I looked up what that actually is...I had none of the symptoms.  I think I was misdiagnosed.  I have only used it twice.  I refused to use it four times a day!!!!
